CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such a superior device performance is the result of the highest J sc and FF achieved ( Table 3 ) when using 80 °C as a spin - coating temperature compared to those fabricated at 60 or 100 ° C. The decrease in both the J sc and FF could be due to inferior polymer chain packing in the active layer leading to a poor charge transporting network. Besides , the device performance generally varied with the length of alkyl side chains attached onto the polymer backbone. The device efficiency initially increases upon the incorporation of longer alkyl side chains from decyl to tetradecyl reaching a maximum at tetradecyl-substituted PffBB-14 and then declines with further alkyl side chain extension. Importantly , such chain Article length - dependent device performance trend is spin - coating temperature independent. The champion PffBB-14 - based device affords the highest PCE of 9.93% with a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . The size of the alkyl side chain is known to affect the processability and interchain interactions of a polymer , which would provide a tool to optimize the π-π stacking interactions of a polymer in the solid state. A size - optimized alkyl side chain would provide a good balance between the π-π stacking interactions of the polymer backbone and the alkyl-alkyl side chain interactions resulting in a highly ordered molecular packing for efficient charge transport. Figure 5a shows the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) spectra of PffBB-n / PC71BM - based PSCs. Strong and broad photo - to - current responses were observed in the range from 330 to 780 nm in all of these PSCs , in which the absorption above 650 nm was attributed to the polymer aggregationinduced absorption broadening. Remarkably , the PffBB-14based device exhibited a much higher photoconversion Article response ranging from 350 to 500 nm than those of other devices , thus affording the highest J sc among all of these devices. As PffBB-n polymers showed similar absorption properties , the high current density of PffBB-14 - based PSC would result from well - ordered polymer : PC71BMnetwork / packing. J sc derived from the EQE spectra were estimated to be 14.12 , 14.92 , 16.29 , and 14.21 mA cm^-2 for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 - based devices , respectively , which were in good agreement with those obtained from J-V characterization ( Figure 6 ). Charge Transfer and Recombination. The charge carrier mobilities of PffBB-n - based devices were estimated on hole - only and electron - only devices using the space - chargelimited current ( SCLC ) model , and the results are summarized in Table 4. Indeed , the highest and well - balanced charge carrier mobility of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend affords a higher J sc and FF than those of other devices. Charge dissociation probability was characterized by photogenerated current density ( J ph ) vs effective applied voltage ( V eff ) measurements.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PffBB-14
2. PffBB-10
3. PffBB-12
4. PffBB-16
5. PC71BM

These are the names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PffBB-14
2. PffBB-10
3. PffBB-12
4. PffBB-16

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities mentioned in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-14 |
| PffBB-10 |
| PffBB-12 |
| PffBB-16 |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such a superior device performance is the result of the highest J sc and FF achieved ( Table 3 ) when using 80 °C as a spin - coating temperature compared to those fabricated at 60 or 100 ° C. The decrease in both the J sc and FF could be due to inferior polymer chain packing in the active layer leading to a poor charge transporting network. Besides , the device performance generally varied with the length of alkyl side chains attached onto the polymer backbone. The device efficiency initially increases upon the incorporation of longer alkyl side chains from decyl to tetradecyl reaching a maximum at tetradecyl-substituted PffBB-14 and then declines with further alkyl side chain extension. Importantly , such chain Article length - dependent device performance trend is spin - coating temperature independent. The champion PffBB-14 - based device affords the highest PCE of 9.93% with a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . The size of the alkyl side chain is known to affect the processability and interchain interactions of a polymer , which would provide a tool to optimize the π-π stacking interactions of a polymer in the solid state. A size - optimized alkyl side chain would provide a good balance between the π-π stacking interactions of the polymer backbone and the alkyl-alkyl side chain interactions resulting in a highly ordered molecular packing for efficient charge transport. Figure 5a shows the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) spectra of PffBB-n / PC71BM - based PSCs. Strong and broad photo - to - current responses were observed in the range from 330 to 780 nm in all of these PSCs , in which the absorption above 650 nm was attributed to the polymer aggregationinduced absorption broadening. Remarkably , the PffBB-14based device exhibited a much higher photoconversion Article response ranging from 350 to 500 nm than those of other devices , thus affording the highest J sc among all of these devices. As PffBB-n polymers showed similar absorption properties , the high current density of PffBB-14 - based PSC would result from well - ordered polymer : PC71BMnetwork / packing. J sc derived from the EQE spectra were estimated to be 14.12 , 14.92 , 16.29 , and 14.21 mA cm^-2 for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 - based devices , respectively , which were in good agreement with those obtained from J-V characterization ( Figure 6 ). Charge Transfer and Recombination. The charge carrier mobilities of PffBB-n - based devices were estimated on hole - only and electron - only devices using the space - chargelimited current ( SCLC ) model , and the results are summarized in Table 4. Indeed , the highest and well - balanced charge carrier mobility of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend affords a higher J sc and FF than those of other devices. Charge dissociation probability was characterized by photogenerated current density ( J ph ) vs effective applied voltage ( V eff ) measurements.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned in the paragraph along with their property names:

1. Polymer: PffBB-n
 * Property name: PffBB-n
2. Polymer: PC71BM
 * Property name: PC71BM
3. Side chain: alkyl side chain
 * Property name: alkyl side chain
4. Absorption range: 330-780 nm
 * Property name: absorption range
5. Photo-to-current response: strong and broad
 * Property name: photo-to-current response
6. Photoconversion Article response: high
 * Property name: photoconversion Article response
7. Charge carrier mobility: hole-only and electron-only devices
 * Property name: charge carrier mobility
8. Charge dissociation probability: photogenerated current density (Jph) vs effective applied voltage (Veff) measurements
 * Property name: charge dissociation probability

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the property name of a material in the paragraph:

1. PffBB-n
2. PC71BM

These are the only two entities in the paragraph that refer directly to the property name of a material.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such a superior device performance is the result of the highest J sc and FF achieved ( Table 3 ) when using 80 °C as a spin - coating temperature compared to those fabricated at 60 or 100 ° C. The decrease in both the J sc and FF could be due to inferior polymer chain packing in the active layer leading to a poor charge transporting network. Importantly , such chain Article length - dependent device performance trend is spin - coating temperature independent. The champion PffBB-14 - based device affords the highest PCE of 9.93% with a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . The size of the alkyl side chain is known to affect the processability and interchain interactions of a polymer , which would provide a tool to optimize the π-π stacking interactions of a polymer in the solid state. A size - optimized alkyl side chain would provide a good balance between the π-π stacking interactions of the polymer backbone and the alkyl-alkyl side chain interactions resulting in a highly ordered molecular packing for efficient charge transport. Figure 5a shows the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) spectra of PffBB-n / PC71BM - based PSCs. Strong and broad photo - to - current responses were observed in the range from 330 to 780 nm in all of these PSCs , in which the absorption above 650 nm was attributed to the polymer aggregationinduced absorption broadening. Remarkably , the PffBB-14based device exhibited a much higher photoconversion Article response ranging from 350 to 500 nm than those of other devices , thus affording the highest J sc among all of these devices. As PffBB-n polymers showed similar absorption properties , the high current density of PffBB-14 - based PSC would result from well - ordered polymer : PC71BMnetwork / packing. J sc derived from the EQE spectra were estimated to be 14.12 , 14.92 , 16.29 , and 14.21 mA cm^-2 for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 - based devices , respectively , which were in good agreement with those obtained from J-V characterization ( Figure 6 ). Charge Transfer and Recombination. The charge carrier mobilities of PffBB-n - based devices were estimated on hole - only and electron - only devices using the space - chargelimited current ( SCLC ) model , and the results are summarized in Table 4. Indeed , the highest and well - balanced charge carrier mobility of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend affords a higher J sc and FF than those of other devices. Charge dissociation probability was characterized by photogenerated current density ( J ph ) vs effective applied voltage ( V eff ) measurements.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the values of material properties in the paragraph! Here are the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Spin-coating temperature:
 * 80 °C (highest J sc and FF achieved)
 * 60 °C (decrease in J sc and FF)
 * 100 °C (decrease in J sc and FF)
2. Length of alkyl side chains:
 * Decyl
 * Tetradecyl (maximum device efficiency)
 * Longer alkyl side chains (decrease in device efficiency)
3. Polymer backbone:
 * PffBB-14 (champion device)
 * PffBB-10
 * PffBB-12
 * PffBB-16
4. External quantum efficiency (EQE) spectra:
 * Strong and broad photo-to-current responses (330-780 nm)
 * Absorption above 650 nm attributed to polymer aggregation-induced absorption broadening
5. Charge carrier mobilities:
 * Hole-only devices:
  + PffBB-14:PC71BM blend (highest and well-balanced charge carrier mobility)
 * Electron-only devices:
  + PffBB-14:PC71BM blend (highest and well-balanced charge carrier mobility)
6. Charge transfer and recombination:
 * Charge dissociation probability characterized by photogenerated current density (Jph) vs effective applied voltage (Veff) measurements.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. Value of Material Property:
 * J sc (current density)
 * FF (fill factor)
 * V oc (open-circuit voltage)
 * EQE (external quantum efficiency)
 * J ph (photogenerated current density)

These are the material properties that are directly related to the performance of the solar cell, and their values are important for evaluating the device's efficiency and performance.
